TopicTitle: Game ran fine yesterday, now fails to start up

Articles.Content: I had a ton of fun messing around in .25 yesterday. Now I went to continue playing, and the game won't launch. It loads all the parts. Then when it's done, it shows the orbiting planets "Loading..." in the bottom right, loading the menu. After a moment, when the menu should pop up, the game stops running. I have no clue why. I also don't know what's important to post here for diagnostics (Save files? Game folder? System specs? Mother's maiden name?) so if there's anything that would be helpful I'll be glad to post it, just ask for whatever's useful. Thanks for any help.

I think with all the new parts, KSP might be pushing memory limits. Try editing your settings.cfg file and set TEXTURE_QUALITY = 1 (or even 2 or 3). Then reload the game and see if it starts up.

I was running into the same problem. KSP was asking for a lot of memory right when it tries to load the main menu (grabbing lots of texture space). I'm not sure if this is a KSP bug or a problem with the memory management underneath.

Cheers,

~Claw
